author: Special Correspondent
text:
It was in the 2014 Lok Sabha elections that six people from Islampur area of the State's Darjeeling district exercised their franchise as voters from “other” category. Since then their [transgender voters] numbers in the subsequent elections have gone up.

With the preparations on for the upcoming Assembly polls in West Bengal, an enthusiasm is also evident among the members of the community who are not shying away from registering their names with authorities.

The updated voter list published by Office of Chief Electoral Officer, shows that as many as 758 individuals have registered under “others” category.

A senior official involved in the up-gradation of the voter list, is hopeful that more voters in the “other” category would be included closer to the polls as the list being is updated.

“We have a subcommittee to look into the matter and is in touch with the Transgender Development Board (TDB) of the State government,” an official said.

Ranjita Sinha, a member of the TDB, who voted in the Kolkata’s Municipal Corporation elections under “other” category sees huge scope of improvement in the area.

“Considering that only 758 have been enrolled there are many who are not included in the voter list as ‘others’.

The emphasis should be sensitising the people and the representatives of the community while making such enrolment,” Sinha said.
title: 758 transgenders register for WB Assembly polls
